active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the pros and cons of standardizing threat intelligence data with STIX versus using proprietary formats in a TIP. How does this impact interoperability, organizational agility, and threat actor profiling for attribution of Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs)?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

Generate 50 high-quality, spaced-repetition-optimized flashcards for the topic 'TIP Data Management' (Category: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Actor Profiling > 001_Threat Intelligence 003_Collection and Analysis > Threat Intelligence Platforms and Standards > TIP Data Management). Incorporate university pedagogy: Cover these exact learning objectives across cards - [insert learning_objectives array here]. Distribute evenly: 20% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, 30% APPLY/ANALYZE, 50% EVALUATE/CREATE. Tag each with blooms_level. Use 4-layer scaffolding progressively (10-15 cards per layer early to late): [insert scaffolding details here]. Tag each with scaffolding_layer. Support active learning: 10% cards reference discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving (e.g., 'How does this relate to debating STIX vs. proprietary?'). Content foundation: TIP aggregates/analyzes threat data (TI: strategic/operational/tactical); IoCs (IPs/hashes); TTPs; STIX 2.1 (SDOs: Threat Actor/Indicator; SCOs: IPv4-Addr/File; SROs: relationships); TAXII (transport); Lifecycle: ingestion/normalization/deduplication/enrichment/storage/access/retirement; Best practices; Role in actor profiling (TTP/IoC mapping); Interoperability. Follow flashcard schema exactly: [insert flashcard_schema here]. Mix formats: 40% MCQ (with distractors), 40% Q/A (recall), 20% cloze-style questions.
